349.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who withdrew from IPL mega auction as he's currently recovering from a back injury, said, "I'm getting a lot of FOMO for not being there and I want to tap my CSK mates." He added, "I hope CSK make it to the playoffs, but it's been a tough start...They need to turn it around pretty quickly."

350.title: Pregnant women face many judgements, but my baby is a miracle: Debina
350.article_body: Television actress Debina Bonnerjee, who welcomed her baby girl on April 3 with husband actor Gurmeet Choudhary, has called her child a miracle. "It was tough, emotionally, physically but everything is worth it when I see her face," she added. Debina further said that pregnant women face many judgements about what to wear, what to eat and how to exercise.

351.title: Heartening to see him grow: Ashneer shares update on Shark Tank contestant
351.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Ashneer Grover took to Instagram to share a picture with Beyond Snack's Founder Manas. Speaking about Manas' business, Grover wrote, "Kerala Banana Chips was the first deal of Shark Tank Season 1 and it's heartening to see him grow 3x in scale profitably within 6 months!" Grover had invested in Beyond Snack.

352.title: Wasim Jaffer shares Hera Pheri's taxi scene to describe PBKS' selection problem
352.article_body: Wasim Jaffer shared the taxi scene from 'Hera Pheri' to describe PBKS' selection problem ahead of their clash against GT. "PBKS trying to fit Bairstow, Rabada, Livingstone, Rajapaksa and Odean Smith into the XI," he tweeted. In the scene, Om Puri's character Kharak Singh and his fellow villagers can be seen spilling out of the taxi while trying to fit.

353.title: Shahrukh could be X-factor for PBKS: Sehwag ahead of PBKS vs GT
353.article_body: Ahead of PBKS-GT in IPL 2022, Virender Sehwag said batter Shahrukh Khan could be the "X-factor" for PBKS if he bats "explosively" down the order. Meanwhile, Ajay Jadeja said pacer Kagiso Rabada is an important player. "If there's any weakness in Gujarat, it's their top-order that hasn't been exposed yet and that's why Rabada is key for Punjab," he added.

354.title: Covishield booster dose to be sold at discounted price of ₹600 plus tax: Poonawalla
354.article_body: Serum Institute of India will sell the precaution or booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield to private hospitals and vaccination centres at a "discounted price" of ₹600, SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said. This came after the government said all adults can take the booster dose from April 10. Covishield's price has been capped at ₹780 (including taxes) at private hospitals.

355.title: Locals can tell relatives they're alive: Ukraine Vice PM thanks Musk for Starlink
355.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has thanked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for Starlink satellite internet. He said that operation of electricity and mobile communications haven't been restored in the village of Ivankiv, but "Starlink came on time". Fedorov wrote, "Locals finally are able to tell relatives that they are alive. Thanks Elon Musk, your help is priceless for Ukraine."

356.title: CBI refuses to provide update through RTI in Sushant Singh Rajput case
356.article_body: The CBI has refused to provide update in reply to an RTI query seeking information in the Sushant Singh Rajput case. The late actor was found dead at his home in Mumbai's Bandra on June 14, 2020. The CBI has stated that the case is in the process of investigation and information about the progress may impede the investigation process.

357.title: B'luru Police arrest 7 of interstate gang for trafficking women abroad
357.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police's Women Protection Wing has arrested seven members of an interstate gang for trafficking women abroad. Preliminary investigation suggested that women from economically weaker sections of society were trafficked abroad after the gang members lured them into lucrative jobs abroad, police said. The victims were from Karnataka, Maharashtra and other states.

358.title: India need a finisher after Dhoni: Shastri on Karthik playing T20 WC 2022
358.article_body: Discussing Dinesh Karthik's potential selection in Team India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2022, Ravi Shastri said India need a finisher after MS Dhoni's retirement from international cricket. "Karthik has got the experience, he has got all the shots," added Shastri. Karthik has scored 90 runs in three IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 204.54.

359.title: Japan recognises Covaxin to facilitate travel between both nations
359.article_body: Hyderabad-based Bharat Biotech informed on Friday that its COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, has been recognised by Japan. "The government of Japan has included Bharat Biotech's Covaxin in the list of recognised vaccines to further facilitate travel from India to Japan starting April 10, 2022," the company tweeted. This development was also confirmed by Indian Embassy in Japan.

360.title: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse...' to release in India on May 6
360.article_body: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' from the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to release in India on May 6. The upcoming film will release in multiple languages, including English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. The Sam Raimi directorial stars Benedict Cumberbatch, Rachel McAdams, Elizabeth Olsen and Chiwetel Ejiofor among others in pivotal roles.

361.title: Glamour isn't the reason why I joined films: Vidya on playing de-glam roles
361.article_body: Vidya Balan, while talking about playing deglamorised roles in her recently released films, said she hasn't joined films because of glamour. "I'm here to tell stories and I am fortunate to get stories, which are very different from each other, each time," the actress said. Vidya further said that she only selects such projects which appeal to her.

362.title: There will be comparisons: Sonu Sood on replacing Rannvijay in 'Roadies'
362.article_body: Sonu Sood has opened up about replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host in the upcoming season of the youth-based reality show 'Roadies'. "When you step into someone else's shoes, there will be comparisons," he said. Sonu added while the "DNA of the show" remains the same, the scale is larger and the journey is more real and raw this time.

363.title: I've been Warner's fan, enjoyed my first outing with him vs LSG: DC's Shaw
363.article_body: Talking about his experience of batting with DC opener David Warner against LSG, teammate Prithvi Shaw said it was great fun. "Once we form a good understanding, it'll be even better to bat with him," he added. "I've been a fan of the way he strikes the ball," he further said. Openers Shaw and Warner scored 61 and 4 respectively.

364.title: Gross tax collections surge to record ₹27.07 lakh crore in FY22
364.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Friday said that India's tax collections rose to a record high of ₹27.07 lakh crore between April 2021 and March 2022. He added that the revenue collection is almost ₹5 lakh crore above the Union Budget's estimates of ₹22.17 lakh crore. Direct tax collections in FY22 grew 49%, while indirect tax collections rose 30%.

365.title: Tom Hiddleston to star in and executive produce 'The White Darkness'
365.article_body: Actor Tom Hiddleston is set to star in and executive produce Apple's limited series 'The White Darkness'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the series is inspired by the true-life account of Lieutenant Colonel Henry Worsley, a former soldier who was deeply obsessed with adventure. The show will be penned by 'Pachinko' writer Soo Hugh who will also serve as executive producer.

366.title: Were confident about chase due to our batting depth: Bishnoi on LSG's win
366.article_body: Following LSG's six-wicket win against DC in IPL 2022, LSG spinner Ravi Bishnoi said he was confident about his side's batting depth while chasing the 150-run target. "The game got a little tight towards the end, but we still had Jason Holder and Krishnappa Gowtham to come," he added. LSG scored 155/4 in 19.4 overs.

367.title: Tribal women protest against cashew crop destruction in Andhra Pradesh
367.article_body: Tribal women staged a protest against alleged destruction of their cashew plantations by a mining company at Urlova village in Andhra Pradesh on Thursday. As a part of their symbolic protest, they imitated the act of suicide by hanging through a tree, saying they would be left with no choice but to end their lives if their plantations weren't saved.

368.title: Woman wins ₹75 cr lottery after accidentally buying wrong ticket in US
368.article_body: A woman won a $10 million (around ₹75 crore) lottery after she accidentally bought the wrong lottery ticket as a person bumped into her while she was trying to purchase a different ticket in California. As per the woman, the person bumped into her while she was selecting the ticket options and ended up buying a $30 ticket.

369.title: We were brilliant with the ball: KL Rahul on LSG's win over DC
369.article_body: After Lucknow Super Giants defeated Delhi Capitals by six wickets, LSG skipper KL Rahul said that his bowlers were "brilliant with the ball" and called the win a "complete team effort". "In the powerplay, we obviously need to go back and work on. But...we assessed things well after that and bowled better," Rahul said.

370.title: Microsoft says it disrupted Russian cyberattacks on Ukraine, EU, US
370.article_body: Microsoft has revealed that it disrupted hacking attempts by a group it nicknamed "Strontium", a Russian GRU-connected actor, aimed at breaking into Ukrainian, European Union, and American targets. The group was using seven internet domains as part of an effort to spy on Ukrainian institutions, government bodies and think tanks in the US and EU.

371.title: Show-cause notice issued to Pune hospital in kidney transplant case
371.article_body: A Pune-based hospital has received a show-cause notice over an alleged fraud during a kidney transplant procedure. The fraud reportedly occurred at Ruby Hall Clinic, where a woman allegedly posed as the wife of a man, who needed a transplant, and donated her kidney to a young woman. In return, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man.

372.title: Conor McGregor charged with 6 offences in driving arrest: Reports
372.article_body: UFC star Conor McGregor was charged with six offences for the dangerous driving case in which he was arrested in Dublin last month, reports said. McGregor reportedly faces two counts of dangerous driving and charges for driving without a licence, among others. Notably, the Irish fighter was released on bail and is due back in court on June 23.

373.title: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory: Sanjay Raut
373.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday alleged that BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory. "A presentation...has been made to the MHA...This has been going on for the last two months and I am saying this with full responsibility," he said, adding that Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray is also aware of this development.

374.title: Sex on the basis of genuine promise to marry that didn't fructify not rape: Delhi HC
374.article_body: A sexual relationship on a genuine promise of marriage that fails to fructify due to external circumstances is not rape, said Delhi High Court. The court was dealing with a matter in which a man and a woman were in a long-term relationship and got engaged but the marriage couldn't be solemnised. The relationship had ended on hostile terms.

375.title: Love the show and Sharma sisters: Priyanka praises Netflix's 'Bridgerton'
375.article_body: Priyanka Chopra praised Netflix drama series 'Bridgerton' for representing Indian culture on the show. "It's so wonderful to see desi representation on mainstream TV. It was...an anomaly when I started. Love the show and the Sharma sisters," Priyanka wrote on Instagram Stories. Based on Julia Quinn's series of novels, 'Bridgerton' features Simone Ashley and Charithra Chandran among others.

376.title: Activision Blizzard makes 1,100 game testers full-time employees
376.article_body: Activision Blizzard has announced it'll make around 1,100 of its temporary and contract quality assurance workers in the US full-time employees, starting July 1. These employees also will be eligible to participate in bonus plan and will have access to full company benefits. "This change follows a process that began last year" across Activision Publishing and Blizzard, a spokesperson said.

377.title: Researchers identify over 5,500 new RNA viruses in the ocean
377.article_body: Researchers have identified at least 5,500 new RNA virus species from 35,000 water samples from oceans across the globe. With this discovery, scientists have doubled the number of known RNA virus phyla from five to 10 to capture the diversity of the new findings. RNA viruses are known to cause several diseases in humans ranging from common flu to COVID-19.

378.title: My mother has a lung disease, please give our dues: Fired BharatPe employee to CEO
378.article_body: A former BharatPe admin in a post said his mother has a lung disease and is hospitalised and he hasn't received his reimbursement for a few months. "I'm the oldest employee of BharatPe working day and night. Why were we thrown out of the company without any reason," Dhananjay Kumar asked CEO Suhail Sameer. "Please give our dues...back," he added.

379.title: She loves her country India: UK finance minister Sunak as he defends wife Akshata's tax
379.article_body: UK Chancellor of Exchequer Rishi Sunak defended his India-born wife Akshata Murthy amid controversy over her non-domicile tax status. Stating that it wasn't fair to ask his wife to sever her ties with India, Sunak said, "She loves her country. Like I love mine." "Every single penny that she earns in the UK she pays UK taxes on," he added.

380.title: We wanted to keep wickets in hand: De Kock after LSG's win over DC
380.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants opener Quinton De Kock said that his side "wanted to keep wickets in hand" while chasing down a target of 150 runs against Delhi Capitals on Thursday. "It was a chaseable score, but we made sure not to get too ahead of ourselves," said De Kock after scoring 80 runs from 52 balls.

381.title: Twitter staffer said staff would be probed if they tweeted like Musk: Report
381.article_body: A Twitter employee said that the platform's employees would be subjected to an HR investigation if they tweeted like Tesla Founder Elon Musk, The Washington Post reported. According to a Slack message, the employee asked if board members are "held to the same standard" as employees. Several Twitter employees are reportedly worried about Musk's addition to the platform's board.

382.title: Fire breaks out at Industrial Development Corporation in Madhya Pradesh
382.article_body: A fire broke out at the Centre for Entrepreneurship Development Madhya Pradesh (CEDMAP) and Madhya Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation (MPIDC) in Bhopal on Friday morning. "At around 6:00 am, we received the information about a fire breaking out at the office...we immediately sent two tenders to control it," a fire station official said. No casualties were reported in the incident.

383.title: England launch their new T20I jersey, share pics
383.article_body: England have launched their new T20I jersey, which will be worn by the England men's and women's teams at the upcoming T20 World Cups. The kit has been designed to enhance performance and ease of movement with fabrics that Castore have used across the highest level of their sportswear, the England and Wales Cricket Board said.

384.title: Can't leave India without permission: Court to ex-Amnesty India chief
384.article_body: A Delhi court on Friday ordered the former Amnesty International India Board chair Aakar Patel to not leave India without permission until a decision is taken on CBI's plea challenging the order to quash look out circular issued against him. The court also put on hold Thursday's order which ordered CBI to tender a written apology to Patel.

385.title: 'Naagin 6' actor Tusharr Khanna buys Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh
385.article_body: Actor Tusharr Khanna, who stars in Ekta Kapoor-backed show 'Naagin 6', has bought an Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh. He took to Instagram to share pictures of his new car. "I feel fortunate to have got love and adulation for my work which made me capable enough to own this today, can't thank well-wishers enough," Tusharr said.

386.title: My kids enjoy watching my films but they're not my fans: Sanjay Dutt
386.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt in an interview has revealed that his children enjoy watching his films but they are not his fans. Sanjay has a daughter Trishala with his first wife late actress Richa Sharma and twins Shahraan and Iqra with his wife Maanayata. In an earlier interview, he had stated that his biopic 'Sanju' is his twins' all-time favourite film.

387.title: Serena Williams hints at comeback, says 'I've got to play Wimbledon first'
387.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has hinted at making a comeback in this year's Wimbledon. When asked about her comeback by NFL player Aaron Rodgers, Serena said, "Wimbledon's before the US Open, I've got to play Wimbledon first." "We've been talking about my comeback...hyping me up and getting me ready for Wimbledon," the ex-world number one added.

388.title: Produce more children, else India will become 'Hindu-less': Yati Narsinghanand
388.article_body: Dasna Devi temple head priest Yati Narsinghanand, who is out on bail in Haridwar hate speech case, has urged Hindus to produce more children to prevent India from becoming "Hindu-less" in the coming decades. "Mathematical calculations state that a non-Hindu will become PM in 2029," he added. Narsinghanand called for a religious assembly in the Mathura-Govardhan region from August 12-14.

389.title: I promise fines for Muslims wearing headscarves: French presidential candidate
389.article_body: French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen on Thursday vowed to issue fines to Muslims who wear headscarves in public. "People will be given a fine in the same way that it is illegal to not wear your seat belt. It seems to me that the police are very much able to enforce this measure," she said.

390.title: A high-end designer told me 'That lehenga isn't for you': Yami
390.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has revealed certain high-end designers refuse to give their outfits because you are not so and so. She added she was once told 'No, that lehenga is not for you' and when she asked why, they said, 'No, just doesn't work with that designer'. "It was so mean...how can you make someone feel so bad?" Yami said.

391.title: BJP conspiring to make Mumbai a UT, I have proof: Sanjay Raut
391.article_body: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory (UT), Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said. "A presentation about the same has been made to the Ministry of Home Affairs...Meetings have been held...funds are being collected," he claimed. "This has been going on for the last two months...I have the proof to substantiate what I am saying," Raut further said.

392.title: We're confident of what we've made: Shahid on not releasing Jersey on OTT
392.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about the decision to release 'Jersey' in theatres despite getting many offers from the OTT platforms, said, "We're confident of what we've made." "We made [it] with the intent of being viewed on...big screen," he added. "The emotionality of the film is such that it's best when viewed with a group of people," Shahid further said.

393.title: Rahul runs Cong round-the-clock, should be made party chief: Sharad Yadav
393.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Sharad Yadav backed Rahul Gandhi's name for the post of Congress President and said that he runs the party "round the clock".  "I think he should be made the party president. Only then can something big be done," Yadav said. Rahul Gandhi met Yadav today, weeks after he merged his LJD party with RJD.

394.title: Pink Floyd members reunite to release 1st song in 28 yrs to raise money for Ukraine
394.article_body: Pink Floyd members have reunited and are releasing their first song in almost 30 years to raise money for the people of Ukraine. The track 'Hey Hey Rise Up' features Pink Floyd members David Gilmour and Nick Mason along with Ukrainian singer Andriy Khlyvnyuk. This will be Pink Floyd's first original song since 1994's 'The Division Bell'.

395.title: UK targets 'lavish lifestyles' of Putin's daughters with new sanctions
395.article_body: The UK on Friday added Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters to its sanctions list in a bid to undermine the "lavish lifestyles of the Kremlin's inner circle" amid the Ukraine war. Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova will be subjected to travel bans and asset freezes, the UK government said. Earlier, the US had imposed sanctions on Putin's daughters.

396.title: 2 suspected Pak spies give flat, iPhones to officials of US Prez's secret services
396.article_body: US has busted an alleged ISI cell of Pakistan trying to intrude into the American intelligence and security apparatus including Secret Service which is in charge of the security of the President. The suspected Pakistani spies, Arian Taherzadeh and Haider Ali, allegedly provided members of the US Secret Service with rent-free flats, iPhones, surveillance systems among other things

397.title: Regret that I didn't do it sooner: Khloe Kardashian on getting a nose job
397.article_body: Khloe Kardashian recently talked about getting a nose job on 'The Kardashians: An ABC News Special'. Khloe said she always wanted to get a nose job. "But it's in the middle of your face and it's scary to think about," she told host Robin Roberts. "My only regret is...I didn't do it sooner," she said while responding to a fan.

398.title: Rohit got frustrated against Umesh who is currently all over him: Hogg
398.article_body: Reacting to Rohit Sharma's 12-ball 3 in MI's IPL 2022 defeat against KKR, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Rohit got frustrated while facing Umesh Yadav who is currently "all over" the MI captain. Umesh dismissed Rohit for the fifth time in IPL history during the match. Umesh is IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder with nine wickets in four matches.

399.title: Probably the find of IPL 2022 so far: Jaffer on LSG batter Badoni
399.article_body: Praising Ayush Badoni, Wasim Jaffer said the 22-year-old LSG batter is probably the find of IPL 2022 so far. Badoni came to bat with five needed off five balls, hitting a four and a six to help LSG win by six wickets against DC on Thursday. He added that Badoni looks like a "real talent" with the way he finished.

400.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Pune; 3 women rescued
400.article_body: Police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a massage and spa centre in Pune's Baner. After receiving a tip-off, police sent a decoy customer to the Divine Spa Centre and later carried out a raid at the centre. Subsequently, police rescued three women and arrested four persons, including the manager of the centre.

401.title: 'Dragon-like' sea creature captured by fisherman in Norway, pic goes viral
401.article_body: A Russian fisherman has shared a picture of a sea creature that resembles a baby dragon, captured by him from the Norwegian Sea. Roman Fedortsov caught the creature, whose pictures have gone viral online, while fishing off the coast of Tromsø in Norway. It has reportedly been identified as a chimaera, a cartilaginous fish also known as a 'ghost shark'.
